result.title: Report on device classification in key markets
result.description: A report will be written detailing the progress made regarding classification of Floating Power Plant’s device. It will include the positive and negative points of each classification type for application to the device, based on the information learned from the experts contacted as part of this project. Details will be given of the direction most suitable for Floating Power Plant, giving clear reasons.

result.title: Report on selected and contracted site
result.description: A report will be written briefly describing several sites which were investigated as part of the project, including an analysis of their suitability for Floating Power Plant’s P80 device. Special attention will be made to the site deemed most suitable, with a clear description of how the site can be used including the logistics relating to each of the value chain, O&M, grid connection etc.

result.title: Summary report of policy engagements and feedback
result.description: A report will be written describing the engagements made as part of this project with key decision makers connected to regulatory frameworks and decision processes. Focus will be made on ensuring that Floating Power Plant gets access to all key areas, despite its position as the developer of the world’s only hybrid device with offshore experience.

result.title: Report on needed certifications and documentation for certification process
result.description: A report will be written describing the currently available certification procedures, and their suitability for Floating Power Plant’s device. Also included will be potential options for developing further certification procedures more specifically applicable to Floating Power Plant. Comparisons will be made regarding the time-lines, costs and reputation associated with each procedure.

result.title: TT&IM group
result.description: A Technology Transfer and Innovation Management Group (TT&IM) will be built with the task to promote and raise awareness of the importance of knowledge and technology transfer, and the commercialisation of research outputs. The group will act as an interface between science and business, being a central point of contact between the Centre and the companies.
